alert.note: Alert for Anderson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 3:40PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson and Union. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the last hour. The thunderstorm producing this rain is nearly stationary so additional rainfall of up to 2 inches seems possible over the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Norris, Andersonville, Norris Dam State Park and Big Ridge State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
